required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of NIV-NAVA vs. N-CPAP After Extubation in Preterm Infants Study
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Non-invasive Ventilation Neurally Adjusted Ventilatory Assist vs. Nasal Continuous Positive Airway Pressure After Extubation in Infants' < 30 Weeks of Gestation: Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized controlled study to compare if a a non-invasive neurally adjusted ventilatory assist (NIV-NAVA) is better than nasal continuous positive airway pressure (N-CPAP) after extubation in infants' < 30 weeks of gestation.

primary_outcome.description: Failure criteria pH < 7.2 with pCO2 > 70mmHg confirmed by capillary blood gas analysis in spite of maximum settings Severe apnea event requiring bag and mask resuscitation FiO2 >0.6 to maintain SpO2 ≥ 88% after extubation Frequent desaturations (< 85%) ≥ 3/hr not responding to increased ventilatory settings or an increase in Fio2 to 1.0

secondary_outcome.measure: FiO2 >0.6 to maintain SpO2 ≥ 88% after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the extubation failure within 3 days after extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Severe apnea event requiring bag and mask resuscitation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the extubation failure within 3 days after extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: FiO2 >0.6 to maintain SpO2 ≥ 88% after extubation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the extubation failure within 7 days after extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: pH < 7.2 with pCO2 > 70mmHg confirmed by capillary blood gas analysis in spite of maximum settings
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the extubation failure within 7 days after extubation

secondary_outcome.measure: Severe apnea event requiring bag and mask resuscitation
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the extubation failure within 7 days after extubation
Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay

Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay
Participants will be followed for 3 days after extubation

arm_group.description: Noninvasive ventilation in this group is practiced with NIV-NAVA
Patients in this group will receive nasal continuous positive airway pressure as routinely in neonatal intensive care unit.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- postconceptional age less than 30+0 weeks
- infants who fulfill the the criteria for extubation for 6 hours extubation criteria: Ventilator rate ≤ 25 breaths/min, Peak inspiratory pressure (PIP) ≤ 16cmH2O, Fractional inspired oxygen (FiO2) ≤ 0.3
Exclusion Criteria:
- conditions which will decrease life expectancy
- major anomalies which will decrease life expectancy
- any anomalous conditions which involve upper and lower airway
- neuromuscular disease

responsible_party.investigator_title: Professor, Director of Neonatal Intensive Care Unit
